title: [Large-Scale] Blended Instructional Design to Improve Awareness of Implicit Bias in Medical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical ethics and patient interaction experience
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment combining interactive activities with digital devices and small-group discussions.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three examples of implicit bias that may occur in medical settings
Learners can reflect on subjective judgments that may arise during patient interactions and practice two strategies to mitigate them
Learners can design a team collaboration protocol to minimize bias influence in data-driven decision-making processes
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
